meanings.definition: A person who is unkempt or slovenly in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The shlub at the party wore wrinkled clothes and messy hair.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a shlub; make sure to comb your hair and tuck in your shirt.
meanings.sent3: The shlub's mismatched socks and untied shoelaces made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Among the elegant guests, he stood out like a shlub in a tuxedo.
meanings.sent5: The image of the shlub with mustard stains on his shirt stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To act in a lazy or careless manner.
meanings.sent1: Stop shlubbing around and finish your chores!
meanings.sent2: She shlubbed through the day, avoiding any real work.
meanings.sent3: He shlubbed his way through the project, causing delays for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The team suffered because he chose to shlub instead of putting in effort.
meanings.sent5: Her boss warned her not to shlub on the job if she wanted to keep it.

meanings.sent1: The movie turned out to be a shlub, lacking any excitement.
meanings.sent2: His presentation was a shlub, putting everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked like a shlub, with its lopsided layers and dull frosting.
meanings.sent4: The party decorations were a shlub, failing to create any festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The new restaurant turned out to be a real shlub, with bland food and poor service.
